greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of congrua: T(n,k) = 4*n*k(n^2-k^2) with n>k>0 and starting at T(2,1) = 24. A055096(n)^2 + a(n) is a square, as is A055096(n)^2 - a(n).
comment: Refers to A057102, which had an incorrect description and has been replaced by A256418. As a result the present sequence should be re-checked. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 06 2015
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Congruum Problem.
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 2, 10}, {k, 1, n - 1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 25 2019 *)
xref: Cf. possible congrua A057102. See also A055096.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 02 2000
ext: Offset corrected by _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 25 2019
